name: npm-scripts-example
description: An example of how to use npm scripts over a build tool like Grunt or Gulp
author: Keith Cirkel <npm@keithcirkel.co.uk> (http://keithcirkel.co.uk/)

scripts.comments: For these commands to work you need to have 'bash' available. In a Unix
environment that is likely a moth point. But in Windows you probably have
it if you installed Git for Windows. It is found in /path/to/Git/bin and
you should ensure that this path to Git/bin is added in your PATH variable.
All references to 'bash' will works as intended in Windows if /path/to/Git/bin
We need to use rifraf because in Windows we get 'File or path name too long'
and we don't delete 'node_modules/.bin' until 'rifraf' is done.
scripts.clean:all: bash -c "rm -rf dist/* bower_components ; rimraf node_modules/* ; rm -rf node_modules npm-debug.log "
scripts.comments: This is an example on how to invoke a command (like 'find') whose name also exist in Windows and
might be found on the PATH before the one on /path/to/Git/bin.
scripts.build: npm run build:scripts -s && npm run build:styles -s && npm run build:markup -s
scripts.build:scripts: browserify -d assets/scripts/main.js -p [minifyify --compressPath . --map main.js.map --output dist/main.js.map] | hashmark -n dist/main.js -s -l 8 -m assets.json 'dist/{name}{hash}{ext}'
scripts.build:styles: stylus assets/styles/main.styl -m -o dist/ && hashmark -s -l 8 -m assets.json dist/main.css 'dist/{name}{hash}{ext}'
scripts.dev: npm run open:dev -s & parallelshell "npm run live-reload -s" "npm run serve -s" "npm run watch -s"
scripts.setup: npm run setup:npm && npm run setup:bower
scripts.setup:bower: echo No need for: bower install
scripts.comments: If this file is updated automatically, only the last 'comments' will be retained
which means this isn't a practical way of adding permanent comments.
echo You can have multiple comment entries, but if you "npm run comments" only the last one is used.
